programme.title: Knightfall
programme.desc: A mysterious knight arrives at Chartres Temple with devastating news. Louis struggles to produce an heir, creating a rift between he and his wife. King Philip sends Gawain on a mission, where he comes face to face with his former Templar brothers. Tom Cullen, Jim Carter and Padraic Delaney star.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Chase fails to show up for his second day as captain, and Dwaine struggles to live up to his dad's expectations.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Ursula closes up her store as she looks forward to a peaceful auction. Meanwhile, Bogart sets his sights on goji juice at an auction in Milton.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Paul is on the lookout for a gift at an auction in Mississauga. Meanwhile, Roy plans to employ some dirty tactics.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: A new competitor threatens Jamie's business, while the crew members are forced to pull out all of the stops to prevent a truck from losing its load.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: With big money at stake the teams are determined to stay on the water, but doubts are raised when sharks venture perilously close to the boats.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The captains are pushed to breaking point when a novice fisherman and pleasure boaters cause them to lose thousands of dollars' worth of bluefin tuna.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank have an unsuccessful search through a pile of junk, but the discovery of a vintage guitar marks a change in their fortunes.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate ancient tales and accounts of robots, contemplating that if such sophisticated machines did exist in bygone days, what might have happened to them.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate whether the stories of a time when gods and otherworldly beings inhabited the planet are more than mere mythology.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A deadly volcano eruption causes catastrophic destruction, a tornado flips cars on a highway, and the HMS Coast Guard carry out a daring rescue mission.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Chase fails to show up for his second day as captain, and Dwaine struggles to live up to his dad's expectations.

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: In Wexford, the guys visit visit The Sky and the Ground pub, where hoarder landlord Johnny Baron's wife Nuala thinks it is time for a clearout of her husband's cluttered attic.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton travel to Missouri to stay with Ton's sister for some rest and recuperation, but on the way they head for an auction.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones uncover a Marilyn Monroe statue, an industrial slip n' slide and a bed of nails at a live auction in Mission Hills, California.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff heads to an auction on his own where he finds LARP weaponry, a sword collection and falconry gear, while Ton Jones soups up their new truck.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen drags Ton to a weekend auction, where newbie buyers cause problems and a rickshaw, a wrecking ball and blast detonators feature.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: A tough group of bidders decide to take on Allen and Ton at auction, where the guys try to sell an arsenal used by Native Americans.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The two guys try to authenticate props from the film Titanic, Ton faces off with a rattlesnake at a snakebite kit sale and Allen gets into ice carving with chainsaws.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton uncover glass blowing tools, autographed baseballs and a hockey puck launcher when sorting through a unit they did not want.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: When Allen and Ton buy a unit full of old whiskey, a night of partying leads to tough sales. Plus, the guys find a set of RC race boats.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers are far from home and get the opportunity to find out who has the skills for the job and who is just relying on luck.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell takes a gamble on a locker completely covered with blankets, while Brandi makes a risky decision.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell finds a box of old books, Jarrod and Brandi battle for a unit filled with classic signs, and Barry takes a chance on a mystery trunk.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi uncover what appears to be an antique wine rack, while Dave and Barry test each other's knowledge of oddities.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers search for hiking and camping gear, and Dave Hester reveals the secrets of auction success.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers travel to Torrance in California, where they bid for a unit containing a classic Jaguar car - but the competition proves stiffer than ever.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Six lockers belonging to one tenant go up for auction as the buyers speculate over the owner's identity.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod argue over the value of a bizarre horse's head. Barry bids for a locker full of antique furniture, and Dave makes his strangest discovery ever.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers travel to the latest set of auctions in Fullerton, California, where Jarrod and Brandi compete for a storage unit they need to keep their store afloat.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers look for 1970s memorabilia in California, where Barry finds a relic from his past and Darrell discovers a lucrative medical device.

programme.title: Ozzy & Jack's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Ozzy and Jack Osbourne visit the Alamo, taking a Mars Rover for a spin at Nasa's Johnson Space Station along the way.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: With previous dives ending in failure, Martin's son Grant offers up an alternative strategy to recover the treasure of the Republic.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.desc: Prince Louis' dark secret is discovered by Margaret. King Philip prepares his army for war, and Landry reunites with his daughter. Historical drama, starring Tom Cullen.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A deadly volcano eruption causes catastrophic destruction, a tornado flips cars on a highway, and the HMS Coast Guard carry out a daring rescue mission.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Rob Beckett, Ed Gamble, Sara Pascoe and John Robins join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the events of October 2016 through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Broadcaster David Dimbleby takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with investigative journalist Stacey Dooley and comedian Henning Wehn joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Katy Perry's American flag dresses are considered for their offensiveness, and Dave discusses insults and, masquerading as his own wife, sets about finding a man on Tinder.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: The host, Bob Mortimer, Russell Kane, Lucy Montgomery and Miles Jupp discuss such sneaky cockroaches, Iranian fruit and how one can 'show off' in the gym a little too much.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Jo Brand, Chris Martin, Tommy Tiernan and Alun Cochrane join Alan Davies around the table to discuss modern male grooming habits and dating unsuitable men.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Don't Say It, Bring It
programme.desc: Game show in which Jason Byrne challenges people in Weston-super-Mare, Glasgow, Bristol and Newcastle-upon-Tyne to bring back the answer to a question, but not to say it.

programme.title: Don't Say It, Bring It
programme.desc: Game show presented by Jason Byrne, in which he challenges people in Newcastle-upon-Tyne, Whitby and Belfast to bring back the answer to a question, but not to say it.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef's travels take him to the River Tarn, where he joins a local angler to fish for pike. He also rustles up a popular confit of duck with braised red cabbage, and meets a chef in Moissac whose dishes are a celebration of seasonal specialities.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food continues his barge journey through south-west France, sampling the famous sausages as he reaches Toulouse and creating the country's most popular ready-meal cassoulet further downstream.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Manhattan, Eddie Hall goes head to head with long-time rival Brian Shaw, pulling a 23-tonne truck - and attempting the notorious skyscraper 'Monster' sandwich from Sarge's Deli.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall visits Fort Worth, Texas, where he takes on a monster pancake challenge, a painful rodeo test, and local delicacy calves' testes in the world's largest Honky Tonk venue.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three motoring enthusiasts head to Spain on a mission to help its struggling economy - but the convertible supercars they take are very expensive and anything but discreet. With Jeremy Clarkson in a McLaren MP4-12C, Richard Hammond driving a Ferrari 458 and James May behind the wheel of an Audi R8 V10, the trio encounter mountain passes, empty towns and an abandoned airport before creating their own street circuit in a deserted Madrid development. Plus, Sherlock star Benedict Cumberbatch sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a project to build a car that can turn into a hovercraft and bring relief to flooded areas. Their efforts do not start smoothly, but it is not long before the trio are demonstrating the brilliance of their creation with an eventful journey down the River Avon. Plus, Jeremy grabs the keys to two variants of the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG supercar - the V8-engined Black Series with a roaring 622bhp, and the 740bhp Electric Drive, which is powered by four electric motors. X-Men and Les Miserables star Hugh Jackman is the latest celebrity to take the new Reasonably Priced Car around the test track.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and his team of explorers head to Greenland in the Arctic. Kayaking the world's largest fjord, they dodge giant icebergs and hungry polar bears.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz make good on a promise to restore a 1935 Auburn and take the original owners for a ride.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank discover a fleet of amazing concept cars, some so unique they do not know how to price them.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz come across a huge 200,000-square-foot factory-turned-private collection by Woody, its dumpster diving owner.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedians Lucy Porter and Romesh Ranganathan and TV judge Robert Rinder to express their anger over people, events and objects that upset them, as the trio vie to banish their top peeves, annoyances, irritation or worst nightmares consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include lavish proposals, school reunions and New Year's Eve.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites sports presenter Gabby Logan and comedians Richard Ayoade and Alun Cochrane to express their anger over people, events and objects that upset them, as the trio vie to banish their top peeves, annoyances, irritation or worst nightmares consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include people who laugh out loud when reading a book, half-and-half scarves - and fun.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian and actor Rob Delaney, presenter Davina McCall and actor and musician Laurence Fox to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include people who order starters, 12-string guitars and cyclists wearing Lycra.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The teams take on one of the steepest courses in Red Bull Soapbox Race history in Lithuania. Will the soapboxes cope with the water jump and savage bone-rattler?.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness, Freddie Flintoff and Chris Harris take the latest sports cars from Ferrari, Aston Martin and Porsche on a Yorkshire road trip. Back on the track, Chris tests out Volkswagen's ID-R electric racer. YouTube star KSI is the studio guest.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and his team of explorers head to Greenland in the Arctic. Kayaking the world's largest fjord, they dodge giant icebergs and hungry polar bears.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Broadcaster David Dimbleby takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with investigative journalist Stacey Dooley and comedian Henning Wehn joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: An extended edition of the quiz show, in which question-master Stephen Fry probes the subject of Messing with Your Mind, with Sarah Millican, Tommy Tiernan and Josh Widdicombe competing alongside resident panellist Alan Davies. As usual, points are awarded for the answers the host finds most interesting, regardless of whether or not they are correct.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: All Girls Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: A female-only special of the comedy show, showcasing some of the funniest women to have graced the stage at London's Hammersmith Apollo. The programme features routines by Sara Pascoe, Sarah Millican, Lucy Porter, Roisin Conaty, Katherine Ryan, Ellie Taylor, Michelle Wolf, Jen Brister, Shappi Khorsandi, Francesca Martinez, Andi Osho and Celia Pacquola.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn goes behind the scenes at London's King's Cross station and finds out about the disused funicular railway hidden in the Avon Gorge in Bristol, blasted out of the cliff.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on a 45-mile walk across Wiltshire, from Avebury to Stonehenge, telling the story of the remarkable development that occurred in the latter days of the Neolithic era. His route over chalk downlands and Salisbury Plain takes him through one of the greatest concentrations of prehistoric sites in Europe.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: It was 30 years after the Romans invaded Britain that they were ready to take on the challenge of conquering the Lake District. With the toughest landscape they had encountered in the nation, peopled by a rebellious tribe, it was no small task, but within a few years, the whole of Lakeland was under their control. Tony Robinson tackles the journey by himself, walking 50 miles from Penrith to Ambleside and on to the Irish Sea at Ravenglass, discovering that the Romans encountered beauty and danger in equal measure.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson takes a four-day trek along the coastline between Plymouth in Devon and Falmouth, learning about the thriving smuggling trade in Cornwall during the late 18th century. The area's tiny secretive harbours, beaches and secluded coves were ideal for illicit imports such as tobacco and brandy, and the business was so huge it threatened the national economy. Along his route, visiting such beauty spots as Lantic Bay and Polperro, he encounters all sorts of reminders of the trade and meets descendants of those involved.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. He begins with a towpath exploration of industrial engineering along the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. Setting off from Liverpool, he takes a three-day walk inland to Wigan, ending at the town's iconic pier as he traces the story of the waterway's chaotic construction and its impact on the development of Lancashire.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Allied offensive in the Pacific, where America's two-pronged attack led to heavy casualties on both sides, as the Japanese mounted a ferocious defence. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Enola Gay drops the first atomic bomb on Hiroshima in August 1945 as America bids to secure an unconditional surrender from the Japanese, even though conventional bombing raids had already flattened the country. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The award-winning documentary series reveals how the end of the Second World War resulted in Britain's military and economic exhaustion, leaving Europe at the mercy of sparring superpowers as the Cold War era dawned. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Jeremy Isaacs' classic documentary explores the Second World War's powerful legacy. For many people the conflict was the most significant experience of their lives, but it also left millions dead - ordinary civilians and victims of persecution, as well as military casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business, which uncovers some remarkably rare vehicles in the picturesque village of Thornton-le-Dale.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of admiring Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his immaculate 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek dives into the lost Jowett marque, as a Bradford-built 1952 Javelin finds an unexpected home. Paul and Dave uncover a Ford Escort that's been untouched for 30 years.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A 1970s Bond Bug three-wheeler divides opinion among Mathewsons customers, while a retired engineer reluctantly auctions off his late father's treasured 60s Jaguar Mark 2.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Mathewsons agree to sell a vintage threshing machine and large collection of tractors, but extracting them from old barns on a Yorkshire farm proves a bigger job than anticipated.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A Cold War Soviet classic goes under the hammer. Built like a tank, the Moskovitch gets few admirers for style, but finds a loving home with a fan of Eastern Bloc classics.

programme.title: Morecambe & Wise in America
programme.desc: Jonathan Ross tells the story of the comedy duo's attempts to become stars in America during the 1960s, via their appearances on The Ed Sullivan Show. Featuring footage never seen in Britain before, as well as personal home movies from Eric and Ernie's own collections, this episode tells of Morecambe and Wise's first steps in their American adventure. Interviewees include Glenda Jackson, Diana Rigg, Gina Yashere, Penn & Teller, Shappi Khorsandi, Jon Culshaw and Nicholas Parsons.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene, in disguise as his own twin brother, faces the unenviable task of arranging a funeral - for himself. Meanwhile, Herr Flick insists his senior officers attend in a bid to seek out members of the Resistance. Comedy, starring Gorden Kaye and Carmen Silvera.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The communists capture Von Strohm and Geering, but they are soon rescued by a Gaullist group, recovering a valuable painting in the process. Comedy, starring Richard Marner and Sam Kelly.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.sub-title: The Dance of the Hitler Youth
programme.desc: The Germans celebrate the burning of the Reichstag with a little Bavarian dancing, while Rene breaks into Herr Flick's lair and the British airmen attempt to cross the channel by rowing boat.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: It is work experience day, but Bren cannot show the new girl a typical routine in the canteen because the new boy has blocked the front of the cooker with his ladder - which the bread delivery woman refuses to go under. Canteen comedy, with Victoria Wood, Thelma Barlow, Sue Cleaver and Shobna Gulati.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Jean vents her anger on the customers, while Tony considers asking Bren to accompany him on a trip to Marbella. Petula returns with interesting news, and Anita celebrates the second week of her relationship with Pedro. Victoria Wood stars.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Bren is so excited about her forthcoming holiday with Tony she even considers buying some new clothes, and while a forlorn Stan tells everyone his sad news, Petula gets a little hot under the collar in her caravan. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Julie Walters.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: James returns to his home town of Bolton to defend a couple living in a run-down flat who have been accused of murdering their baby daughter. However, conflicting testimony soon brings him up against his learned friend, Head of Chambers Peter Foxcott. Starring John Thaw, Oliver Ford Davies and Haydn Gwynne.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: First of two-part crime drama from the prolific pen of Lynda La Plante. DCI Roisin Connor is called in to investigate the gruesome discovery of a woman's severed hand in the River Thames, and soon finds herself pitted against rival officer Chief Superintendent Mike Walker as they are drawn into a deadly game with a psychotic killer. Victoria Smurfit and David Hayman star.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.sub-title: A Rose by Any Other Name
programme.desc: A middle-aged widow's family become convinced a photographer is only marrying her for money and ask Hetty to investigate. Given a week to probe his past and find out whether he's a gold-digging cad or a 24-carat gentleman, the unlikely sleuth unearths some extremely interesting facts. Drama based on the novel by David Cook, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: The Boys Are Back in Town
programme.desc: Neil Manson and estranged wife Pippa consider getting back together, while Gabriel takes the opposite course in his private life and decides to stop seeing secret girlfriend Zoe Dowman. Sheelagh brings daughter Siobhan into the station to experience a day in the life of a police officer, while Jack Meadows and the CID team investigate the source of fake passports being printed somewhere in Sun Hill.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Amanda Prosser steals all the credit for Gina's impressive initiative on antisocial behaviour, and teenage rapist Ross Trescot begs June to drop the charges against him, trying to excuse his actions by claiming to be a victim of sexual abuse. Roger finds himself attracted to a mugging victim's housemate, while Jo Masters and Suzie Sim present Neil with incriminating photographs of his father-in-law.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Neil Manson clashes with his father-in-law when he learns the former Deputy Assistant Commissioner's involvement with underage boys has left him open to blackmail. Sam Nixon discovers the body of a missing Muslim estate agent and makes Phil Hunter jealous by arranging a date with the dead man's boss, while Gina's drinking leads to a complaint that could end her career. Andrew Lancel and Scott Maslen star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PCs Hemmingway and Bryant arrange a battle of the sexes against Roger Valentine and Dan Casper which boosts Sun Hill's clear-up rate at one stroke, but Gina's decision to celebrate their success in the pub while still on duty gives Amanda Prosser all the leverage she needs to get rid of the boozy Inspector. Ramani and Terry accept they will never be friends and Pippa Manson creates an embarrassing scene at the station when she learns Neil's investigations led to her father's death.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Drama set in 1895, chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. The first episode sees Eleanor embarking on her medical career _ and immediately crossing swords with eminent surgeon Sir Herbert Hamilton. Jemma Redgrave stars in the title role, with David Calder as her father, and Robert Hardy as Sir Herbert.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor opens her new infirmary for the poor, but also agrees to help in her father's private practice. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Round Tower
programme.desc: Feature-length drama set in the 1950s, starring Emilia Fox as the rebellious teenage daughter of a successful businessman and his devoted wife, whose disenchantment with her privileged upbringing ultimately provokes a scandal in their small town. Keith Barron and Jan Harvey also star.

credits.actor: Emilia Fox as the rebellious teenage daughter of a successful businessman
her privileged upbringing ultimately provokes a scandal in their small town

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Elizabeth finds out that Sarah is also in Sydney and arranges a meeting, Olivia and Carolyn make preparations for a card party for Sir Richard and George discovers who Anna's real father is.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah attends a back-street doctor, but cannot go through with the operation. Carolyn gets offered a job as art critic for one of Sir Richard's Sydney newspapers.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Daddy has an accident while chasing a milkwoman on his bicycle, and ends up heavily sedated in hospital. First-ever episode of the suburban sitcom, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and George Webb.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth invites the new vicar round for tea - but despite her meticulous planning, the afternoon does not go as planned. Sitcom about a super-snob intent on climbing the social ladder, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Jeremy Gittins.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth visits a stately home, where she naturally tries her hardest to meet the lord of the manor - only to be thwarted by the untimely arrival of Onslow and Daisy. Suburban comedy, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A distant cousin of Fred's who has Down's syndrome is taken in by the Buckles following the death of his protective mother, but Violet struggles to cope and Shelagh is forced to make other arrangements for his care. New recruit Valerie prepares for her first day at Nonnatus House, and Trixie comes to the aid of a pregnant woman who is in urgent need of dental treatment to avoid an infection. The nurses discover what has happened to Sister Mary Cynthia, a revelation that has distressing consequences for Sister Monica Joan.

programme.title: Harrow
programme.desc: A mummified body is found bricked up in the basement of a suburban home, leading Harrow and Grace to investigate a crime from the past.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: The discovery of a man's body in a disused mine shaft reawakens villagers' suspicions over a girl's death - and the mismatched duo's investigation lifts the lid on murder, mystery and intrigue. Feature-length drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan as the chalk-and-cheese detectives, with Polly Hemingway and Joe Duttine.

credits.actor: Colin Buchanan as the chalk-and-cheese detectives

programme.title: Tomorrow Never Dies (1997)
programme.desc: James Bond joins forces with a Chinese agent to foil a media mogul's scheme to start a war between their countries - a case complicated by the fact that an old flame is now married to his new enemy. Using an undetectable stealth ship, the press baron plans to launch an undetectable sneak attack on both nations' navies, knowing they will blame each other - giving him exclusive global media coverage of the resulting conflict. Spy adventure, starring Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce, Teri Hatcher and Michelle Yeoh.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Rylan Clark-Neal in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to £10,000

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Busy observing the sky in search of UFOs, Magoo accidentally finds himself wandering over to Fizz's house..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo, hunting for Pinkbeard's treasure, mistakes the park for an island. Fizz and Weasel are there, selling ice cream that never falls on the ground..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo has decided to go mountain climbing but in reality, he is climbing up a skyscraper! He mixes Fizz up with a wounded bird and ruins his plan.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The clumsy hero sets out to replace his worn-out sofa, but finds he does not have enough cash for a new one.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless halfwit finds a treasure map in a dusty corner of his attic, but the road to riches proves a rocky one.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Get ready for awesome action adventures with Humungosaur! Taking out villains is all part of the fun for this hero. His mission - to save the day!.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Strange Strife of the Smelly Socktopus
programme.desc: The boys pull out all the stops to get themselves suspended when Erica describes it as a vacation..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The Spuds take the camper van on holiday, and end up at the bottom of the sea. Dave has to resort to a resourceful solution to get help..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave rescues an endangered donkey from the docks. Hiding it in the camper van, things take a turn when the donkey eats Gran's glasses..

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James and fellow chef Mark Jordan discover the culinary delights of Guernsey. They sample local speciality Gache cake and a seafood platter fit for a king, while James uses the island's native dairy produce to make a creamy rice pudding with chargrilled peaches. The duo set themselves a fishing challenge by attempting to catch a mighty turbot, and James finishes the day by cooking a mouthwatering turbot dish.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches Amman in the eastern Mediterranean country of Jordan. He catches up with his old friend Maria who runs a cookery school, discovers how the country is becoming a serious wine-producing region and visits a bustling fruit and vegetable market for ingredients. Ainsley's dishes include chargrilled sumac lamb cutlets with tabbouleh and falafel with hummus.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: The duo are joined by Gordon and Tilly Ramsay, who prepare salmon en croute, and Juliet Sear, who makes thumbprint cookies. Plus, recipes for pull-apart bread stuffed with bacon and cheese, paella, patatas bravas, Greek salad, and strawberry pavlova.

programme.title: The Village
programme.desc: As summer begins, Delyth starts planning for the wedding season and the staff at Portmeirion celebrate the work of Susan Williams-Ellis - the pioneer behind its pottery. The programme also meets Rob Piercy, who has spent 25 years capturing the village on canvas.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The owner of local country magazine Midsomer Life becomes a suspect when a man's body is discovered in woodland, and it is established the victim had been having an affair with his wife. As Barnaby and Jones delve into the case, another murder forces them to reassess their inquiries. Detective drama, starring John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Simon Williams.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team are at Wigan Athletic's DW Stadium, where Alys Dobbie is interested by a collection of cameras and Jon O'Marah finds out what a Corinthian aryballos is and Tony Geering assesses three 1966 World Cup trays.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win £250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, however, they have all used up their Golden Buzzers already - each granting a place in the live semi-finals to their chosen acts.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, including a woman being kicked by a horse, a driver who tears off her car door and a teenager falling face first into manure.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Family Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents the game show in which four relatives team up - this week the Patels from Essex - and pit their wits against one of the finest quiz brains in the country, in the hope of taking away thousands of pounds.

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson stars as the Parisian detective in this drama based on the novels of Georges Simenon. The summer of 1955 finds Paris in the grip of both sweltering heat and terror on the streets. Four women have been murdered in Montmartre, with no apparent connection between the victims. Chief Inspector Maigret comes under huge pressure from the public and his superiors to apprehend the killer before he can strike again. Fiona Shaw and Mark Heap head up the supporting cast.

programme.title: Mike Bassett: England Manager (2001)
programme.desc: An inept soccer coach is unexpectedly chosen as England's new manager. His dismal efforts see him go from national treasure to most hated man in England in record time - but the chance of redemption comes when a rules loophole puts his team in the running for the World Cup. Comedy, starring Ricky Tomlinson, Amanda Redman, Philip Jackson, Bradley Walsh and Phill Jupitus.

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Action from the latest edition of the weekly AEW event, featuring all of the biggest stars on the roster, including Adam Page, Chris Jericho, Cody and Jon Moxley.

programme.title: Mollie King's 20 Superstar Girls
programme.desc: The Saturdays singer and Strictly Come Dancing star Mollie presents her own show of wonder women who rule the music world, including Adele, Madonna, J-Lo, Britney & Beyonce.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Young Guns' claim is ravaged by a vast dust storm. Meanwhile, the Boulder Boys chase old leads and the Bushmen face a disaster fifteen metres underground.

programme.title: Jungle Gold
programme.desc: George returns home to fight a lawsuit, leaving Scott with sole responsibility for doubling gold production on the pair's claim.

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground
programme.desc: Rob Nelson searches for a mass grave that could harbour a dark secret. Plus, a giant lake seems to be disappearing, and Rob set off to find out why.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Jr is asked to build a bike inspired by the restoration of Ground Zero in Manhattan, and there are rumours Rick is unhappy at OCC.

programme.title: Alaska Mega Machines
programme.desc: The documentary series explores how Alaska's Coast Guard manage to negotiate risky waters to maintain buoys standing three stories tall. Plus, construction of a steel ferry.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe goes to work on a cattle farm in Indiana, where he helps to inseminate cows and deliver baby calves.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: A look at the Porsche 911, and how its manufacturing processes have developed over the years.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew explores the inner workings of a Ferrari FF to find out how it is made.

programme.title: Outback Pilots
programme.desc: Documentary outlining the work of pilots who risk their lives every day flying through Australia's inhospitable Outback terrain. Crop-dusting ace Dennis faces extreme low-level flying in a race to complete the biggest job of the year, while Trevor and his rookie aviators prepare to save tourists in a fierce storm.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While cruising through Florida, skilled 'pickers' Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz go hog wild in a former juke joint-turned-picker's paradise.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike and Ant work on a 1969 Opel GT, which suffers fresh body damage, a backfiring engine, shoddy brakes, and faulty headlights.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer spots a well-maintained Mercedes 560SL, which was the car of choice for rich petrol-heads in 1987, and sets out to give the vehicle a complete refresh.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard hits the Giant Shepton Flea Market, where he unearths some retro design classics. Plus, in Devon, he visits Europe's largest repository of vintage fairground rides.objects.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Blacksmith Neville has his expert skills tested with the restoration of a cast iron 19th-century fireplace. Plus, Alex restores a 1930s table into a farmhouse centrepiece.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: French polisher Alex restores a 1930s rocking horse. Sculptor Nick rescues a mid-century piece and upholsterer Craig attempts to restore a classic Victorian chair.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Master blacksmith Neville Morris works on a piece of railing that was once a Victorian club fender. Meanwhile, Martin restores a Second World War RAF hero's bomber jacket.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: In Anglesey antique dealer Saxon Durrant charms leather craftsman Martin Ashworth with an incredibly rare and impressive vintage 1920s Louis Vuitton wardrobe trunk.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Upholsterer Craig tries to restore a Robert Dawes reclining library chair. Plus, Alex takes on a big project with a near pair of two Dutch 18th-century marquetry tables.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Walter brings his 1975 Bricklin back to the garage, with the hope that Dan can fix problems that were created when it was built. They then add missiles.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While cruising through Florida, skilled 'pickers' Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz go hog wild in a former juke joint-turned-picker's paradise.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restore a clock made from the propeller of a First World War plane, a pair of stained glass windows, and an ancient shoe-stretching machine.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Sensing the chance to get some bargains, Drew Pritchard checks in on some contacts who are downsizing and selling off collections. In Norwich, he finds a beautiful Victorian umbrella stand.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard examines furniture in a Black Country factory. Next, in Derby, a new contact pays off when he finds the crankshaft from a Battle of Britain fighter plane.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Preston, a job centre is demolished and in Yeovil a 20ft yacht is ripped to pieces. Plus, in the Somerset village of Woolavington, a sculptor is on the hunt for scrap material.

programme.title: Legend of Croc Gold
programme.desc: Vast gold resources lie among south east Asia's island rivers, but they are also home to crocodiles, and locals need the help of professional to extract the valuable ore.

programme.title: Serial Psyche
programme.desc: Experts and investigators explore the crimes and backgrounds of serial killers who work in pairs. They look into the psychology of Fred and Rosemary West and others..

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How crime writers research their material, combining the perspectives of police, criminals and journalists to provide detailed accounts of illegal activity.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: In 2015, Edward Lowry was found savagely beaten to death in South Dakota. With little evidence left behind, police had to piece together Ed's last moments from CCTV.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The shotgun murders of John and Carolyn Tarwacki. When John Tarwacki Sr discovered the bodies of his son and daughter-in-law in February 2010, the only story told at the scene was found in the snow. Boot prints revealed the path the killer had taken, but the search for a motive led police in a startling direction.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Detectives investigate how a Phoenix security van and its guard disappeared while transporting a large consignment of money.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An investigator rescues ferrets abandoned in a house in freezing temperatures, and a colt is discovered in such a bad condition it cannot stand up.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Kate investigates why a rabbit has stopped eating. Plus, a sausage dog receives experimental treatment and Dr Peter helps a monkey with suspected tuberculosis.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Candice is shopping with her mother, with three weeks to go until her wedding, while Jacy arrives at the salon with an entourage.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: The Big Day
programme.desc: The story of Amanda, a self-proclaimed 'daddy's girl' who has a huge budget for her wedding and will stop at nothing to get exactly what she wants.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown takes on his most frightening mission ever, rescuing a trapped snake. He also helps an endangered turtle and has a shocking discovery with puppy Tyson.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown tends to Honey the dog, who has jumped out of a moving car to chase a cat. Plus, Tasmanian devils fight a mysterious illness, and a koala losing its sight.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: When Annjeannette was nine, a public campaign was set up to send her to fat camp. The fat-shaming has continued, and she has struggled with food addiction.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: At 400lbs Bettie Jo achieved a dream - pregnancy. This catch-up sees how she coped. Plus, and update on Susan, who has found a new relationship but needs to maintain motivation.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: A woman who has lost more than 300lbs much less dependent on her husband than she used to be, while one of Dr Now's most challenging patients is ready for a major confrontation.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Idaho roofer and avid hunter Jeramy Burt, who vanished in February 2007 shortly after telling his ex-wife he intended to seek a new life. Several months later, his car was found torched in a remote desert, but he had taken no other personal items with him other than his mobile phone.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Lindsay wants a new dress to replace one that has been ruined, while Caitlyn has already spotted her dream outfit at another salon, but could not find the right size.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sarah has her hands full with Rachel, who wants a sexy wedding dress with lots of bling, while Melissa has a limited budget and no idea what she is looking for.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Carla wants a glitzy gown, but her mother prefers something elegant and sophisticated, while Natasha hopes wedding shopping will help her reconnect with her mum.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Adrianna's choice of dress leads to a nervous fitting, while Joey hopes to make a decision, having tried on more than 100 gowns.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Carli arrives at the salon with an entourage in tow, while Jessica brings her baby, mother, aunt and two friends to attend her wedding dress fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Ivania returns to Kleinfeld Bridal for a reselection, hoping her fiance will agree to the dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Margarita already has two gowns but is determined to buy a third, while wedding-obsessed Amanda begins searching for her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nicole and her vocal family visit the store, while Amanda's mother refuses to leave until her daughter's dress is fixed.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Larry Jr shares his views on the idea of his mother conducting readings at a baby shower, which makes Theresa Caputo have second thoughts on whether to go ahead with it.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo and Larry try to stress the value of college to their daughter Victoria, but the pressure of senior year becomes too much for her.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo is taken by surprise when her skills are suddenly put to the test at a local radio station. Later, she accompanies her husband Larry to a tattoo shop.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo takes a day trip to New York when she is booked for a group reading, but the hustle and bustle of the city threatens to disrupt her ability.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Featuring a woman who has to deal with her obsessive collecting so there is more room for her grandchildren.

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: A profile of American serial killer Jeffrey Dahmer, who sexually assaulted and killed 17 men in his Milwaukee apartment between the late 1970s and early 1990s. A necrophiliac who also practised cannibalism, he was beaten to death by a fellow inmate in a Wisconsin jail in 1994.

programme.title: 1000lb Sisters
programme.desc: Amy undergoes gastric bypass surgery, but endangers herself by not sticking to the post-op diet. Meanwhile, Tammy seeks support from her love interest.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A young man becomes violently ill and dies soon after eating a fish sandwich, leaving the medic to determine whether it was the result of a rare and lethal form of food poisoning or an unlikely killer. Plus, a woman is killed in a car accident with a drunk driver and the autopsy reveals several devastating clues that she may have played a key role in her own tragic death.
